str2: Probably from the same as pale; anew, i.e. back, once more, or furthermore or on the other hand.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 1st Person Singular
str2: (properly: To call (summon) to witness, and then absolutely) To testify, protest, asseverate; To conjure, solemnly charge.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Dative Masculine Singular
str2: To cut around, circumcise. From peri and the base of tomoteros; to cut around, i.e. to circumcise.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
From opheilo; an ower, i.e. Person indebted; figuratively, a delinquent; morally, a transgressor.
(a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
All, the whole, entire, complete. A primary word; 'whole' or 'all', i.e. Complete, especially as noun or adverb.
From a primary nemo; law, genitive case, specially, (including the volume); also of the Gospel), or figuratively.
